title: Test
yAxis: Consumer credit in billion U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Consumer credit in billion U.S. dollars, with a total of 19 data points.
Overall Consumer credit in billion U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.

Consumer credit in billion U.S. dollars is rapidly increasing from 2000 to 2007, roughly constant from 2007 to 2008, slightly increasing from 2008 to 2014, roughly constant from 2014 to 2015, roughly increasing from 2015 to 2016, and lastly roughly constant from 2016 to 2018.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2015 and 2016.
Max Consumer credit in billion U.S. dollars about 3918.3 was recorded at Year 2018
Min Consumer credit in billion U.S. dollars about 1716.97 was recorded at Year 2000
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Consumer credit in billion U.S. dollars, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 2 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2009 to 2018.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly increasing which exists from 2000 to 2009.
